Use Models¶

Models (and their sub-models) in medsegpy are built by functions such as get_model:

from medsegpy.modeling import build_model
model = build_model(cfg)  # returns a torch.nn.Module

Note that build_model only builds the model structure, and fill it with random parameters. To load an existing checkpoint to the model, set cfg.INIT_WEIGHTS to the appropriate weights file. MedSegPy recognizes models in Keras’s .h5 format.

You can use a model by just outputs = model.predict(inputs). Next, we explain the inputs/outputs format used by the builtin models in MedSegPy.

Models and Generators¶

The Generator.img_generator yields batches of input and ground truth masks in the expected Keras format. See data_loading] for an example of how this is done.
